snippet: After receiving a major penalty and a game misconduct in Game 1, Penguins forward Matt Cooke is finding it hard to escape his reputation as a dangerous cheap-shot artist.
abstract: Pittsburgh Penguins forward Matt Cooke is finding it hard to escape his reputation as a dangerous cheap-shot artist; he was called for a major penalty and a game misconduct for checking Boston Bruins defenseman Adam McQuaid from behind in Game 1 of NHL Eastern Conference finals.
lead_paragraph: After receiving a major penalty and a game misconduct in Game 1, Penguins forward Matt Cooke is finding it hard to escape his reputation as a dangerous cheap-shot artist.

headline.seo: With Latest Hit, Penguins’ Matt Cooke Further Injures His Image
headline.main: With Latest Hit, a Penguin Further Injures His Image
headline.print_headline: With Latest Hit, a Penguin Further Injures His Image
